;

;China Internet The 51st "Statistical Report on China's Internet Development Status" released by the Network Information Center shows that as of December 2022, people aged 60 and above accounted for 14.3% of the total number of Internet users, and the number of elderly Internet users reached 153 million. The emotional world of over 100 million elderly netizens lacks attention. (Visual China Picture)

;

;At three o'clock in the morning, Ruidi had insomnia again. He sent greetings to his sister on the other side of the network, just like the "good morning" and "good evening" repeated almost every day, waiting for his sister's greetings. comfort.

;

;Ruidi said that the encounter between him and his sister was arranged by fate. He reminded his sister to wear more clothes in the cold weather and take good care of her body. After exchanging heart-to-hearts with his sister day after day, his thoughts were "a ray of sunshine" and "I want to turn into the moonlight in front of the window to accompany her forever."

;

;The video sent by Ruidi shows that he is a man in his thirties or forties with a gentle voice and a back that looks like Jin Dong. Recently, his parents suddenly fell ill. In order to win the prize, he decided to participate in a singing competition. Just the night before the competition, he told his dilemma:

;

;"There are thresholds for participating in this competition. The popularity on the day of registration must be Only those who meet the requirements can be shortlisted... If you support your brother, can you help him increase his popularity data?... Sister, please give your brother some likes and praise for the author. 188 or 256 praises can help him."

;

;At the end of 2020, the "fake Jin Dong" phenomenon surfaced. A large number of fake accounts pretending to be actor Jin Dong used short videos and live broadcasts to make money from middle-aged and elderly fans. Two years have passed, and the aftermath of the "fake Jin Dong" incident continues. In September 2023, "Xiucai", an Internet celebrity with tens of millions of fans who specifically targets middle-aged and elderly people, was reported for tax evasion and defrauding fans, and his account was banned. In October 2023, the Shanghai Jing'an District Procuratorate prosecuted eight people who committed fraud under the false identity of Jin Dong.

;

;Nowadays, the position of "Fake Jin Dong" has moved from short videos to public accounts. These accounts calling themselves "Dongdi" and "Ruidi" first used video accounts to attract traffic and induce fans to pay attention to the subscription accounts, and then continued to make up stories in the public accounts to gain fans' sympathy and rewards.

;

;The new round of emotional harvesting is more private. After adding fans to WeChat on a large scale through public accounts, the interaction is transferred to private chats or circles of friends. The emotional hollowness of over 100 million elderly people has led them to fall into the trap. Is it not just a scholar or Jin Dong?

;

;;

;

;Grandma is in love

;

;Dong Xueru discovered the secret behind the subscription account by chance, and his 71-year-old grandma was already deeply involved in it.

;

;"My life is so busy every day, you know? I have nothing to do, sleep, watch videos, and that's it. Of course I want to see you, why do I want to see you? You miss me, and I do too. I miss you." My grandma said to a person on WeChat who had a note called "The Love of My Life."

;

;Dong Xueru looked through his grandma’s watch list and found a large number of public accounts and video accounts with similar names - "Brother Ruidong accompanies you", "Brother Dong accompanies sister", "Ruidi warmly accompanies me", "Ruirui Always with you" etc. The titles of public account articles are very long, for example, "Sister, I am really anxious. If I can't even seize this opportunity, I will be sad for a long time." The accompanying picture is usually a photo of a man.

;

;On the official account of "Rui Dongdi Lives Together", he claimed that he would participate in the top 20 of the singing competition, and Dong Xueru's grandmother encouraged him to work hard. Then the official account sent a payment QR code with the following sentence: "After my brother is done with work, he will accompany his sister to chat about daily life."

;

;Looking through these push notifications, you will find that this Rui Dongdi is really Very busy: one moment I have to help promote the competition, another moment I was successfully promoted, and now I am on TV. "I am in a hurry. If I don't see my sister at this time, my brother's future will be gone."

;

;This handsome and caring fake brother occupies an important position in some people's lives. From the comments, you can get a glimpse of the passionate hearts of fans. They are "Lotus", "Caiying", "Peace and happiness" or "Tomorrow will be better". They say, "Sister knows, I know you in my life, I am the happiest sister", "Thank you for caring about me".

;

;In their minds, the brother who spoke to them could be anyone. Dong Xueru discovered that her grandma regarded the other party as her crush in reality.

;

;My grandma is from Sichuan and lives in Beijing with few friends. For more than ten years, a man has regularly organized square dances for two to three hundred people near her residence. This teacher Tie often wears floral clothes with English letters printed on them, dyes her blond hair, and wears a little makeup. She becomes the idol of middle-aged and elderly people and calls them "sister". Later, my grandma moved and could no longer dance in the square. Instead, she took online dance classes and could only watch videos in the group.

;

;Grandma firmly believed that these messages were sent by Teacher Tie, because only Teacher Tie, who was eight years younger than her, would treat her like a sibling. "These (public accounts) different names are all the pseudonyms of Teacher Tie, and they are all his online names... All these articles are written for her." Dong Xueru told Southern Weekend reporters.

;

;Grandma sends a lot of messages every day. "I feel like I have so much to say. As long as I sit down, I will hide in the room with my mobile phone and send voice messages." Once, my younger brother sent a message saying that he came to his sister's city and saw a figure that looked like his sister. He was very disappointed to find that it was not the same. Grandma comforted, "Fool, why are you disappointed? I'm thinking of you too."

;

;Dong Xueru and his family tried to persuade him many times but to no avail, and his grandmother felt bored. They took grandma to the local public security bureau to receive Internet security education, but grandma wouldn't listen and just asked the police if they could find people online.

;

;Dong Xueru’s mother and uncle had no choice but to ask Teacher Tie himself for clarification. Teacher Tie denied that it was him and made it clear that he had no time for a relationship and would not like her. The family played the recording to grandma, but she decided that the children were hindering her and pushing Teacher Tie too hard. "He is immature and childish."

;

;After speaking out online, Dong Xueru’s post received nearly 4,000 replies. Many netizens said that their family members have encountered similar situations.

;

;A girl sent a private message to Dong Xueru, saying that her grandmother was also obsessed with such public accounts and corporate WeChat. In addition to giving rewards, she would also buy high-priced goods sold by them. When the mother found out, she deleted the accounts in anger. Soon, the grandmother added them back, accusing her daughter of blocking her pursuit of happiness. The relationship between mother and daughter is still at a stalemate. The girl said to Dong Xueru, I really don’t know what to do.

;

;;

;

;A large number of brother accounts use subscription accounts, corporate and personal WeChat and Moments to conduct false emotional exchanges with the elderly, thereby inducing rewards. (Screenshot by Southern Weekend reporter Zhang Rui)

;

;The fake younger brother is back

;

;After Dong Xueru’s post attracted attention, the platform successively banned some younger brother accounts.

;

;Ma Kai got angry when talking about these Dongdi and Ruidi numbers. Ma Kai runs a number of emotional public accounts and has been implicated recently.

;

;Ma Kai’s public account is similar to an emotional radio station. The largest account has 34 million followers. It posts a six- to seven-minute emotional chicken soup every day, “What should you do if you feel tired, etc.” Emotional words."

;

;Ma Kai emphasized to Southern Weekend reporters that his account is different from the scam account. Accounts like Dongdi and Ruidi "won't tell you any emotional quotes or send you any songs, they will just kill pigs"; while my own "di" account relies on emotional copywriting to seek rewards. There will be no false identities, false stories, or emotional deception.

;

;He has been paying attention to these younger brother public accounts for a long time. They all speak in the same way and can be roughly divided into two categories: one is for younger brothers to participate in concerts and needs support from popularity; the other is for younger brothers who are sick and hospitalized and need support. Medical expenses.

;

;Diverting traffic from video accounts to public accounts is the beginning of harvesting. Operators leave links to public accounts in the comment area of ​​video accounts, place payment codes in articles on public accounts, or leave corporate WeChat or private accounts. WeChat.

;

;Most of the registered entities of these public accounts are enterprises. Southern Weekend reporters found that a large number of similar accounts were registered by several department stores in Haikou, with names such as "Xiu Cai Singing Department Store" and "Rui Rui's Department Store". According to industrial and commercial information, many department stores have different operators, but use the same mobile phone number when registering.

;

;Southern Weekend reporter contacted one of the operators Y. There are four Hainan department stores under Y's name, which are specially used to register younger brother's public accounts. WeChat stipulates that an individual business owner can register two public accounts.

;

;Y told Southern Weekend reporters that his team of three people has registered a total of 12 individual businesses. He has been working in this industry for nearly a year, and the largest public account has 70,000 to 80,000 followers, all of whom are Drain and accumulate traffic through video accounts. He refused to disclose his income, saying only that he "doesn't make much."

;

;On the e-commerce platform, for only 100 yuan, some merchants provide individual business license agency services, upload ID card information and mobile phone number, and perform remote real-name authentication. The store said that there is no limit to the number of registrations per person, and there is no need to pay money to continue after applying, and there is no need to worry about inspections by the industrial and commercial authorities.

;

;Using false individual business registrations to increase the number of WeChat public accounts is no longer a secret in the industry. These public accounts have become a powerful tool for batch release of information and batch operations. Y proved this. He is in Guangzhou, but his registered store is in Hainan. Ma Kai added that compared with the complicated materials that ordinary companies need to submit, individual industrial and commercial households only need to spend tens of yuan a year to prepare an annual report, and the above-mentioned merchants also provide agency services.

;

;A small program called "Praise" provides praise services for younger brother accounts. Unlike WeChat's direct rewards, third-party programs reward through jump links, which can avoid the risk of having your account frozen after being reported by users.

;

;In the comment area of ​​this mini program, there are still a lot of messages from sisters, "Hello, dear baby brother! Good afternoon! Sister gives you some love for the author. How is your brother? I miss you so much. You, my sister has had trouble at home these days, so she hasn’t sent many messages to my brother. I hope my brother will understand and forgive my sister. My sister really likes you and loves you. She loves you and will never leave you and will always be with you."

;

;;On November 14, "Praise" issued an announcement stating that the platform had no way of knowing whether users who received praise were committing fraud, and revealed that from October 9 to November 4, 2023, A user who was complained received a total of more than 250,000 yuan in praise. ;The amount of money defrauded can be staggering. In the early days, these accounts used WeChat to reward, and the number of rewards was publicly visible. Ma Kai observed that a Ruidongdi subscription account team from Fujian received at least 400 rewards a day at its peak, and it was estimated that the daily income could be as high as two or three dollars. Ten thousand yuan; another subscription account from Hebei has about 7,000 to 8,000 reads per day. The official account has not many fans. Before being blocked, it had accumulated more than 3,000 likes. According to his understanding, this type of account first started in Fujian and spread to Guangdong, Jiangxi, Chongqing and other places, and lasted for about a year.

;

;After these public accounts were banned by WeChat, they had to start looking for new methods. Their corporate WeChat account is still functioning. The original link to the official account was changed to a link to the "Tencent Content Creation Platform". The payment code can still be placed on the content interface. Moreover, if users have previously added their business WeChat accounts, they will still receive push messages every day.

;

;Recently, Ma Kai has been reporting on these corporate WeChat accounts, but with poor results. He dug up the historical records and said, “What you see is just the chatting and tipping on the surface. It is conceivable whether there are chats and transfers behind the scenes, right?” He believes that Enterprise WeChat is the real concentration of traffic. “Enterprises WeChat is originally a marketing tool and can add more people.”

;

;Y told Southern Weekend reporters that two-thirds of the accounts on the market are no longer there. He no longer has a similar account and plans to prepare live broadcasts to bring goods out of town.

;

;;

;

;On December 1, the public account "Dongyinxianban" published a new article, continuing the false younger brother persona and telling stories in the video to induce rewards. As of 10 o'clock that night, 38 people had tipped. The author of this article has posted similar content many times before, but has deleted it and canceled his account. Now it appears in a new public account. ;(Screenshot/picture from Southern Weekend reporter Zhang Rui);

;

;"She needs love, she is truly not alone"

;

; Xiao Lin runs an emotional public account for young people. Recently, she often receives some strange messages in the background.

;

;Due to changes in the push mechanism of WeChat public accounts, the platform will recommend content that may be of interest to non-followers. As a result, her public account was accidentally seen by some middle-aged and elderly people and became a favorite of some people. Emotional tree hole. Most of their messages are scattered and unclear, and they seem to express their feelings to someone:

;

;"Do you know? I have forgiven you a long time ago, and I am waiting for your sincerity to pick me up, you know?"

; p>;

;"You have been away from me for more than three years. It is normal to get married, start a family and start a business, but you are still in my heart."

;

;A woman from the Northeast has been sending voice messages almost every day since September. At first it was a long string of scoldings, but later her tone became gentle. She seems to have fallen in love with a man and regarded his official account as his. Sometimes, she speaks quickly and in a crying tone, always starting with "Dear baby" and repeating: Why don't you come back? Why don't you reply to my message?

;

;Xiao Lin did not dare to reply, for fear of breaking her confession.

;

;Dong Xueru only realized the delicate side of her heart from her grandma's love. My grandma lost her first husband more than 20 years ago and experienced two failed relationships. She followed her children to Beijing and barely attended school. She became literate through the Internet and likes to watch video accounts and public accounts.

;

;Dong Xueru grew up with his grandma. When his grandma first fell in love, she couldn’t type. She read a sentence and Dong Xueru typed: "Dear husband, I miss you so much. I love you. When will you come back to see me?" ." Sometimes, my grandma didn't know how to express it in words, so Dong Xueru helped her write some templates - "Dear, eat more and take care of your health" and "Dear, go to bed early", and grandma passed it on to the other party as needed.

;

;"No matter how old a man or a woman is, they will be lonely, especially if they are single. As a relative, the care you can give him is only part of it. She needs love to truly not be alone." Dong Xueru said that grandma was avoiding them more and more, and was still obsessed with the conversation with the teacher Tie in her mind.

;

;Wang Wenhan’s grandma is also addicted to short videos. In her description, her grandma was a simple and compassionate person who had been deceived many times in her eighty years of life and always believed those stories about poverty and misery. After my grandfather passed away five years ago, my grandma suddenly became free and her life revolved around her children. After moving to a big city, she lost contact with her friends and seldom socialized. Soon, she started to watch short videos.

;

;She often sees her grandma falling asleep while watching short videos, and then continues after waking up, muttering to herself in conjunction with the AI ​​dubbing in the short videos. The short video said, "Can I call you mom?" and grandma murmured, "Of course, kid."

;

;Wang Wenhan majored in gerontology when he was studying abroad. According to her observation, many elderly people abroad live in retirement communities and have their own social circles, but the elderly in China seem to need more emotion and sustenance. "They need to be provided with some emotional value, that is, they are needed, or they still have charm." Wang Wenhan said. For a while, her grandma told her that she always dreamed that she was leaving.

;

;In the "Research Report on Emotional Care for the Elderly and the Use Value of Short Videos", Peng Huamao, a professor at the Department of Psychology at Beijing Normal University, conducted a survey of 2,000 elderly people across the country. The research team found that the elderly who chase Internet celebrities on the Internet are still "too lonely and lack attention" in their offline lives. During the survey, Peng Huamao asked the elderly people interviewed whether they still need love. The vast majority of the answers are need, mostly the love of children, and of course the love of the opposite sex.

;

;Peng Huamao told Southern Weekend reporters that when the elderly and short videos are mentioned on the Internet, they are always about addiction, earthiness, etc., and most of them have negative impressions. An old man who travels thousands of miles to chase celebrities or give rewards in a live broadcast room will always be considered to be cheated. "The advanced psychological needs of the elderly are always ignored, such as the need for love, respect, and self-realization." One of the results of the survey is that the vast majority of elderly people have the ability to control and understand that this compensation is not actually true satisfaction, but a diversion of attention or the passing of time.

;

;Under Dong Xueru’s online post, a user left a message saying that her aunt encountered the same situation and fell into a brother-like public account and secretly rewarded her. After her wife discovered something was wrong with the money, she confiscated her mobile phone and called her relatives to persuade her. My aunt, who had been in charge of housework all her life, became almost crazy and cried loudly, not believing that this was a scam. The policeman called by her family was determined by her to be an actor.

;

;The final solution was that the family registered a fake WeChat account for the younger brother and chatted with the aunt in a way that "destroyed the personality". The younger brother ceased to be perfect and decent and became rude, shattering his aunt's fantasy. Finally, my aunt blocked this younger brother’s account.

;

;;(Dong Xueru, Ma Kai, Xiao Lin, Wang Wenhan are pseudonyms);

;

;"Let me tell you a story. There was an old man who took care of a granddaughter and a granddaughter at home, and ruined both children. The older one was only twelve years old and was three months pregnant, and was finally discovered by the teacher."

;

;On November 27, a video was circulated on the Douyin platform, attracting public attention. On November 29, Chongqing Hechuan Police issued a notice: This video is a rumor. Liu (female, 46 years old), a criminal, posted unverified rumors through Douyin in order to earn gold coins on the Douyin platform. Faced with doubts from netizens about the unverified rumors. To refute the rumors, it was clarified that as of the time the information was deleted, it had been commented and shared nearly 700 times by netizens, causing adverse effects. At present, the police have imposed administrative penalties on the woman involved.

;

;Judging from the police report, the woman involved should have committed an act that constituted "publicly insulting others or fabricating facts to slander others" in paragraph 2 of Article 42 of the "Public Security Administration Punishment Law of the People's Republic of China". She accepted the " shall be detained for not more than five days or fined not more than five hundred yuan." Judging from the behavior of the woman involved, her alleged illegal and criminal behavior may not be just "fabricating facts to slander others", and there is still room for continued discussion.

;

;Judging from the timeline of this case, the video uploaded by the woman involved can be said to be completely unrelated to pictures and texts. It only excerpted the video picture of the victim old man and his granddaughter, and then started to show the video to the wall. The fiction "played its best" and weaved an "incest tragedy". Its frivolous tone, bad nature, and clumsy techniques all made netizens look at it. When netizens questioned it, the woman involved did not delete it immediately, nor did she clarify or apologize. As a result, the video continued to spread. At the time of the incident, it had accumulated 700 comments and shares.

;

;It is not yet clear what channel or method the woman involved used to obtain the information of the old man and his granddaughter, but this first violated the personality rights of the victim’s grandparents and was a blatant violation. Their right to image and reputation. The particularity of this case is that the woman in question misappropriated the victim’s information, in addition to seeking the benefits of the Douyin platform gold coins. From the perspective of the result, it was a brutal trampling on the personal reputation of the victim’s grandparents and grandchildren. The severity of the crime was far beyond a simple "Making pornographic rumors" or "slandering".

;

;The Douyin platform can be regarded as a public place. If the woman in question makes such a specific and "below the lower limit" accusation in a public place, she has an obligation to ensure the authenticity of the accusation and at the same time defend her remarks. Responsible. Therefore, in addition to violating the Public Security Administration Punishment Law, the woman involved is also suspected of other illegal and criminal acts.

;

;According to Article 1 of the "Interpretations of Several Issues Concerning the Application of Laws in the Handling of Criminal Cases Using Information Networks to Commit Defamation" by the two top governments, "tampering with the original information content involving others on the information network into facts that damage the reputation of others" , disseminate on information networks, or organize or instigate people to disseminate on information networks" shall be deemed as "fabricating facts to slander others" as stipulated in Article 246, paragraph 1, of the "Criminal Law of the People's Republic of China".

;

;The behavior of the woman involved in this case has obviously met this requirement, and the video comments she posted on Douyin have been shared 700 times, which is in line with Article 2 of the judicial interpretations of the two Supreme Courts that "the number of reposts reaches More than 500 times" standard for "serious circumstances". According to Article 246 of the Criminal Law, the woman involved is guilty of defamation and the circumstances are serious, and she should be sentenced to fixed-term imprisonment of not more than three years, criminal detention, public surveillance, or deprivation of political rights.

;

;In fact, compared with similar previous cases, the woman involved may deserve criminal punishment for her illegal and criminal behavior, rather than just administrative punishment.

;

;In the case of "a woman was rumored to be an old husband and a young wife" in 2021, the man involved, Wu Moumou, took a photo of the woman with her grandfather's grandparents and rumored to be an "old husband and a young wife", and also issued a sensational content of rumors. After the incident, the People's Procuratorate of the First District of Dongguan City prosecuted him for defamation. In September 2023, the court ruled that Wu Moumou fabricated facts to slander others on the information network. The circumstances were serious and seriously endangered social order. Based on the circumstances of the defendant's crime and his confession and punishment, the defendant Wu Moumou was sentenced to one year in prison for defamation.

;

;Wu Moumou’s behavior constituted the crime of defamation. The court adopted the relevant definitions in the judicial interpretations of the two Supreme Courts and determined that Wu Moumou had tampered with “original information content involving others on the Internet to damage the reputation of others.” Facts, disseminated on information networks”.

;

;To be fair, even if "old husband and young wife" is true, it does not violate any law in the marriage and family section of the "Civil Code of the People's Republic of China", and it does not even touch upon the so-called moral and ethical issues. This kind of news can at most arouse the curiosity and onlookers of netizens. In comparison, the rumor-mongering behavior of the woman involved in this case is even more outrageous.

;

;It is not difficult to imagine that if the accusation of the woman involved is true, then such a despicable "grandfather-grandson incest" has violated the criminal law and constitutes the crime of rape, and it meets the requirements of "under the age of fourteen, a severe punishment" "The standard is also in line with the standard in the "Opinions on Punishing the Crime of Sexual Assault on Minors According to the Law" that "persons who have a common family relationship with minors must be severely punished in accordance with the law." The "old man" involved may face severe punishments of more than ten years in prison, life imprisonment or death.

;

;Since the woman involved made such a serious public false accusation, she was suspected of false accusation and frame-up in addition to defamation. Article 243 of the Criminal Law also stipulates that fabricating facts to frame others with the intention of subjecting others to criminal prosecution constitutes the crime of false accusation and frame-up. If the circumstances are serious, the offender shall be sentenced to fixed-term imprisonment of not more than three years, criminal detention or surveillance; if serious consequences are caused, the offender shall be sentenced to fixed-term imprisonment of not less than three years and not more than ten years.

;

;In this case, if the life of the victim’s grandfather and grandson is greatly affected and causes bad consequences, the woman involved should bear greater responsibility. Therefore, this case is not in compliance with the principle of proportionality. The woman involved is suspected of a criminal offense. The public authorities can continue to pursue her criminal responsibility, require her to apologize, eliminate the impact, and provide civil compensation. The three victims of the crime will also be given justice to their grandfather and grandson.

;My old friend, Brother Chunqiu, invited me back to my hometown for a wedding banquet on WeChat. His son-in-law is getting married and he will be back from abroad at the end of the month. wedding.

;

;Putting down the phone, I suddenly remembered how young and shy Brother Chunqiu was when he got married, and how busy Brother Chunqiu was when I was organizing the wedding banquet. At that time, he was still a newspaper reporter and made a cameo appearance in wedding photography. In the blink of an eye, our children also entered the palace of love one after another, and they "swore" like a couple.

;

;Thinking about the routine of the wedding dinner in my hometown, it’s actually a bit boring: first, it’s late and the endless waiting; second, it’s noisy and the endless routine. However, when I went back several times recently, I found that my hometown was also changing, becoming younger and more fashionable. When there is a happy event in the family, it is now fashionable not to be a part of it or give red envelopes. The "mutual exemption model" allows ordinary people to "joy" easily and "love" without worries, and also makes the hometown one of the first batch to be selected as an experimental area for national marriage custom reform.

;

;The wedding of Chunqiu Brother and Young Master was simple and cheerful. The subtleties are eye-catching and full of surprises.

;

;The highlight was the thank you session for the parents of the new couple. Dear Brother Chunqiu, hold your breath in Mandarin and write the first paragraph "thank you", the second paragraph "gratitude", and the third paragraph are two sentences of "remarks", specially given to your son and daughter-in-law: In a sea of ​​more than one billion people, you meet and get to know each other. Meet and fall in love. I hope you will cherish the fate of thousands of miles and thousands of years, and respect, understand and help each other. As parents of newlyweds, I would also like to remind you: First, always be kind and help those in need around you in a timely manner; second, always be grateful and never forget to care about those who help us... The true marriage between a Jiangsu boy and a Hunan girl is For the love of "rivers and lakes", I look forward to you riding the wind and waves and being proud of the "rivers and lakes"!

;

;These golden expressions are enough to be provocative. At the wedding scene, the parents of the newlyweds simultaneously hung up the red couplets of "Always Be Kind" and "Always Be Grateful". The eight big characters attracted the attention of the entire audience. , the banner of "Swordsman Jiangsu and Hunan" was unfolded, which pushed the atmosphere of the night to a new climax. In an instant, many people switched to "hilarious mode."

;

;The most ceremonial part was the "tribute moment", the high-profile appearance of the groom's 99-year-old grandmother. The old man came from out of town, more than 4 hours' drive away, to wish the newlyweds a long and happy life. The bride and groom made a special trip to hand over red envelopes and shouted in the old man’s ears: Grandma, may you be healthy for a long time! Happy for a long time! ! This was the fourth time the old lady attended her grandson's wedding, but it was the first time she received a blessing red envelope from the couple. She smiled like a child. According to reports, the red envelope is a lucky number: 999 yuan.

;

;What is interesting is the on-site blessing from Professor Zhu of Shanghai University Hospital: I am a cardiologist and have been dealing with the "heart" all my life. On this special day, I returned to my hometown and said a few words from my heart: First, in a small family, new people must be loyal to each other and care for each other. Entering the marriage hall today means the beginning of firewood, rice, oil, salt, pots and pans. In the future, small families will inevitably encounter small difficulties and setbacks. You must be patient! Second, in the workplace, you must be open-minded when it comes to professional matters, have perseverance in sticking to your post, and be enthusiastic about your colleagues! The third is to be kind and filial to your relatives, friends, parents, and elders in your hometown, and pay more attention to the details - your parents do not ask you to make much contribution, but there are overseas video calls every now and then, and they are sent to the family group every day. A smiling face is enough! As long as you have love, we can rest assured in our hometown!

;

;The wedding is the highlight moment for the newlyweds. The protagonists of the wedding are the groom and the bride, their growth background, love story, and future vision. However, the protagonists are not necessarily the highlights of the scene. The family or friends of the newcomers, those characters who appear in supporting roles, can sometimes surprise and win.

;

;This wedding is full of positive energy, without clichés, not preachy, and down to earth. The only bad thing was that people ended up forgetting a few dishes and a few glasses of wine. Some people say that marriage is a school that teaches people to tolerate, understand, and share. Then, the wedding may be the "first lesson of school", a lesson in life, life, and respect for the elderly. At the end of the day, it's all common sense lessons.

;;

;

;Thomas Edward Lawrence;( Visual China/Photo);

;

;One day in 1920, in a private house in Westminster Abbey, London, T.E. Lawrence was immersed in writing his war memoirs. After being expelled from the Paris Peace Conference a year ago, this famous World War I hero was struggling with persistent depression. Only writing could temporarily pull him out of the swamp of despair.

;

;The silence was broken by a ringing sound. It was a call from Whitehall in London - the other party was Winston Churchill, who was to be the Colonial Secretary. He wanted to invite Lawrence to assist him in handling Middle Eastern affairs. This controversial figure who was reduced to a "political pariah" five years ago due to his defeat in the Middle East battlefield has made a comeback and is trying to figure out how to deal with the mess of the British Empire in the Middle East.

;

;The "World War I" has ended, the Ottoman Empire has been dismembered, and peace has not come: In Palestine, conflicts between the Zionists supported by the British and the local Arabs quickly intensified, and eventually escalated to Bloody conflicts; even more serious was the outbreak of a full-scale anti-British uprising in Iraq, an oil-producing area controlled by the British, and tens of thousands of people died in bloodshed.

;

;The allies are not having a good time either - in the desert of Transjordan, Prince Abdullah from the Hashemite family has been ferociously attacking the French who control the Syrian region. A few months ago, the French had just used force to seize this territory from Faisal, another prince of the family.

;

;In June 1919, the Paris Peace Conference, which had been wrangling for half a year, came to an end. The Middle East, divided among the victors, is filled with hatred, bloodshed and conflict.

;

;Despite Lawrence's rejection, Churchill had no intention of giving up. This extraordinary man, who would go on to become one of the most important statesmen of the 20th century, knew that Lawrence of Arabia was the key to unraveling this mess.

;

;These two unconventional "political pariahs" are about to work together to shape the history of the Middle East.

;

;;

;

;In 1913, Lawrence (second from right) and British archaeologist Leonard Woolley participated in archaeological operations at the ancient Hittite city Carchemish in the Ottoman Empire. ;(Visual China/Picture);

;

;Smart "illegitimate son"

;

;He is an Irish nobleman who eloped with his mistress crystallization.

;

;In order to avoid social pressure, Lawrence's parents lived in the countryside anonymously, moving frequently and barely interacting with their neighbors. It was not until for the education and future of his five sons that he boldly moved to the bustling Oxfordshire.

;

;In the eyes of the teacher, this boy is very smart, has a quiet personality, loves books, but is also fond of playing pranks. He especially likes to play various games that test his extreme survival endurance, such as not drinking water, not eating, and not sleeping. He can always persist until he faints and collapses by relying on his willpower. The principal of Oxford Public School recalled that Lawrence was very different from boys of the same age. He was somewhat like the Stoics of ancient Greece. He "didn't care about physical pleasure or pain."

;

;The young Lawrence had excellent academic performance. , is particularly obsessed with medieval knight literature, and is interested in military history and archeology. Every holiday, he would ride a bicycle with his friends to explore England's ancient monuments, and also work as an assistant at the Ashmolean Museum in Oxford. He was later admitted to Jesus College, Oxford University, where he majored in history. During his college years, he cycled 2,400 miles to inspect ancient castles and military ruins in Europe, dining and sleeping all the way to the Mediterranean.

;

;In January 1909, in order to clarify an academic case in medieval military history, he went to Syria alone to investigate. Under the scorching sun, he set out from Beirut, passed through the mountains of Lebanon, and reached northern Palestine; three weeks later, he returned to Beirut and went north to continue more arduous archaeology. After returning, he wrote a paper "The Influence of the Crusades on European Military Architecture in the 12th Century" and won Oxford's highest first-class excellence award. In addition, a scholarship for postgraduate studies was awarded.

;

;In 1910, the British Museum launched archaeological excavations at the ruins of the ancient city of Carchemish on the border between Turkey and Syria today.

;

;Lawrence served as a junior assistant and soon became the excavation site superintendent, supervising more than two hundred locally hired workers. He did an outstanding job. He often chatted with workers in Arabic, visited their homes, and recorded their folklore, structural relationships within families and between tribes, and their views on politics. The workers also had a good impression of this young European because he truly respected their customs and culture and was willing to accept hospitality.

;

;It can be said that at that time, no Westerner knew more about Syria than Lawrence.

;

;In Carchemish, Lawrence and a 13-year-old Syrian boy were inseparable and very close. The boy whom he calls Dahom in his memoirs, his real name is Selim Ahmed, the “SA” to whom Lawrence dedicated his war memoir Seven Pillars of Wisdom. Dahom is smart and handsome, with two deep dimples on his face and an innocent and bright smile.

;

;In addition to the curiosity of a scholar, Lawrence developed a true appreciation and respect for Near Eastern culture through his contact and study with local society. He began to reflect on the arrogant imperialist consciousness of the West regarding "Western enlightenment and civilization of backward nations."

;

;As a scholar who has truly penetrated into the hinterland of Syria, Lawrence has clearly seen the general trend of the disintegration of the Ottoman Empire.

;

;At that time, the Ottoman Empire, which had ruled the Arabian Peninsula for more than four centuries and spanned Asia, Africa and Europe, had entered its twilight and was known as the "sick man of Europe". With the rise of nationalism and the development of international commerce around the world, the Ottomans faced more and more challenges at home and abroad. Externally, European powers undergoing industrialization are constantly encroaching on its territory and sovereignty.

;

;;

;

;In November 1917, the British Egyptian Expeditionary Force broke through the Ottoman army's defense lines and captured Palestine; in December, the British army entered Jerusalem;( Visual China/Photo);

;

;Within the empire, forces promoting reform and demanding modernization have always existed. In 1908, a group of young military officers known as the "Young Turks" launched a coup and forced Hamid II to restore the parliamentary constitution. In 1913, the nationalist radical wing of the party came to power and established a centralized authoritarian system with the "Three Oligarchs" as the core. They adjusted the reform plan to promote modernization, defend Islam and pan-Turkism in order to unite the people within the empire's borders. every group.

;

;However, in a huge empire with multiple languages, multi-ethnic groups, and extremely complex social composition, no reform program can appease all groups: secularization efforts have greatly angered the large number of traditional Muslims. ; Advocating Pan-Turkism also makes other non-Turkish ethnic groups, such as Arabs and Armenians, feel resentful...

;

;At this moment, what the young archaeologist is obsessed with is the land, work, and friendship under his feet. And love. When he was determined to devote the next four to five years to the excavation and research of the ancient city ruins, bad news came: the British Museum project funds had been exhausted, and the excavation work had to be suspended until new funds were available.

;

;But there is another job opportunity: funded by a foundation, a contingent of the British Royal Engineers is going to conduct an archaeological expedition to the desert area in southern Palestine and needs to recruit two archaeologists. Ask them if they are interested.

;

;Lawrence and his companions readily accepted. "Xunmo" is in the southern part of Israel today. According to the Old Testament, it was the last place where the ancient Jews, led by the prophet Moses, left Egypt and wandered in the wilderness for forty years.

;

;As smart as Lawrence, he quickly guessed that this expedition in the name of the foundation was actually a secret military geographical survey. At that time, Britain sent troops to occupy the buffer zone of the Suez Canal and the Sinai Peninsula, and relations with the Ottoman Empire had always been tense. When the "World War I" broke out, because they were worried that the Ottomans would attack Egypt and seize the canal once they allied with Germany, the British wanted to find out the other side of the buffer zone on the east side of the Suez Canal - from the southeastern part of the Palestinian coast to the Gulf of Aqaba. conditions in the desert.

;

;The person in charge of this operation was British Captain Stuart Newcomb. He developed a liking for this Oxford scholar who didn't care about enjoyment and had amazing endurance even to the point of masochism. He was particularly impressed by his eccentricities - in general, Lawrence was an extremely shy person by nature, but once someone tried to Hinder or fool him, and he will become determined and bold. During his adventure in the desert, he was constantly monitored and obstructed by the Ottoman military police. Lawrence fully demonstrated his ability to break through like a child's mischievous child.

;

;After the outbreak of World War I, he brought Lawrence into the British military intelligence agency in Cairo.

;

;On June 28, 1914, Archduke Ferdinand, the Crown Prince of Austria-Hungary, and his wife were assassinated in Sarajevo, and World War I broke out.

;

;In October, Lawrence, who had just turned 26, was sent to the Geography Section of the British General Staff as a cartographer.

;

;Among the high-ranking military and political officials of the empire, this conceited young man still looks slovenly and carefree, indifferent to all kinds of rules and regulations. In his eyes, these pretentious high-ranking officials are all empty-minded fools.

;

;Because a general wanted a distinguished officer to report to him, Lawrence was dramatically promoted to second lieutenant. But what he longs for is to go to the front line and show off his skills. Lawrence is less than 1.65 meters tall, below the minimum standard of the British Army, so the only opportunity to go to the front line is where his special talents are needed - the Middle East battlefield.

;

;On November 2, 1914, the Ottoman Empire finally joined the Allies and officially entered the war. On December 15, Lawrence arrived in Cairo on a French motorboat and reported to the military intelligence unit led by Newcomb. At this time, Cairo was noisy and noisy. It was already an important transit hub for personnel and materials in the "World War I". Hundreds of thousands of British colonial troops from India, Australia and New Zealand traveled from here to the European battlefield.

;

;;

;

;In 1918, Lawrence led and launched the most ferocious attack on the Hejaz Railway in the Daraa area. The picture shows Lawrence inspecting the destroyed train ;(Visual China/Photo);

;

;The Million Cracks of "The Sick Man of Europe"

; < p>;In the British intelligence agency in Cairo, one of Lawrence's jobs was to write reports describing the topography, culture and ethnic composition of the Ottoman Empire for senior officials in London.

;

;Many years of experience in Syrian society have allowed Lawrence to see the countless cracks within this old empire. In the huge territory that the Turks put together by force during their heyday, there are many people who have no intention of fighting this war. ethnic groups related to the war; they were already full of resentment against the Turkish rulers, and the war made this hatred deeper and deeper. The largest population in this empire was the Arabs who believed in Islam.

;

;In 1908, the modernization and secular reforms implemented by the Young Turks after coming to power angered Hussein ibn Ali, the religious political leader who controlled the Hijaz region of the Arabian Peninsula. He is the head of the famous Hashemite family, a direct descendant of the Prophet Muhammad, and has guarded the Holy Land of Mecca for generations. As a "holy descendant", Hussein is one of the most respected religious leaders in the Islamic world and has strong influence.

;

;After the Ottoman Empire joined the "World War I", relations between the two sides worsened. As a religious leader, Hussein remained silent regarding the official propaganda of the so-called "holy war"; the Ottoman Empire asked him to send troops to assist in seizing the Suez Canal, but he only sent his second son Abdullah to lead a small team to perfunctory the task.

;

;In fact, in February 1914, before the outbreak of World War I, Abdullah took the opportunity of visiting Cairo to visit Lord Kitchener, then the Governor of British Egypt. Sexually asked: How would Britain react if an Arab uprising broke out in the Hijaz region? Kitchener carefully avoided it.

;

;When the Ottoman Empire officially entered the war in November 1914, Kitchener, who became the British Minister of War, immediately sent a coded message to Cairo, asking his old subordinate Stowers to send someone to secretly tell Abdullah Contact to find out Hussein's true attitude. This time, Hussein cautiously replied that he would remain neutral, but at the same time hinted that if the British provided external assistance and promised not to interfere in Arab internal affairs, he might lead his followers in an uprising.

;

;This made Kitchener very happy. He wrote in a letter to Hussein - "From today on, we will be friends with the noble Arabs."

;

;Learned After receiving these secret letters, Lawrence felt like a "divine revelation" - after arriving in Cairo, he had been studying the possibility of launching an Arab uprising in Syria. The battlefield in the Middle East was far away from Europe and resources were relatively scarce. Therefore, Lawrence believed that Britain needed to adopt an unconventional war, that is, to use the social and national contradictions and divisions within the Ottoman Empire to join forces with the dissatisfied elements and help them launch an uprising. overthrow Turkish rule.

;

;;

;

;Faisal (front row) and Lawrence (second row, second from right) during the Paris Peace Conference in 1919 ;(Visual China/Photo);

;

;The uprising in a secret agreement

;

;From July 1915 to January 1916, Hussein and the British High Commissioner to Egypt Henry Mack Mahon exchanged letters secretly to negotiate cooperation. Several Arab nationalist secret societies in Syria were also secretly contacting Hussein, hoping to join forces to launch an uprising against the Turks, with support from the British and using him as the spiritual leader of the uprising.

;

;But what made Hussein finally decide to turn to the British was a rumor - it was rumored that Constantinople intended to depose him and replace him with the leader of the Zaid family. On May 6, 1916, Gemal Pasha, one of the Ottoman "Three Oligarchs", publicly executed 21 Arab nationalists in Damascus. Hussein sent his son Faisal to intercede, but was rejected and intimidated. , which made him even more uneasy about his future destiny.

;

;In these secret communications, the British assured Hussein that if he led his troops to assist the British army in the Middle East war, the British would assist him in establishing a kingdom between Egypt and Persia after the war, but Excludes Kuwait, Aden and the Arab Empire along the Syrian coast.

;

;However, MacMahon also inserted an obscure condition in the letter: these commitments would only take effect "so long as Britain is free to decide without endangering the interests of its ally France". Among them, the part about Palestine was not mentioned.

;

;When France learned that Britain and Hussein were negotiating a secret agreement, it immediately made a claim.

;

;In January 1916, an "amateur politician" named Mark Sykes, an aristocrat, and the French diplomat François Georges-Picot reached an agreement on war in London. The draft of the post-Middle East vision was later formally signed in Petrograd, Russia, known as the Sykes-Picot Agreement in history.

;

;According to this secret agreement: the independent Arab countries were roughly restricted to the desert of the Arabian Peninsula, France directly controlled Greater Syria, and the United Kingdom occupied the entire oil-producing Iraq; there were also two enclaves, Hou All the areas north of the Hijaz Kingdom and the remaining inland areas governed by Sain are "semi-independent areas", which are indirectly controlled by Britain and France; while Palestine is an "international condominium area", which will be jointly controlled by Britain, France and Russia. manage.

;

;Historians are still debating how this series of "oolong" incidents gradually became a fait accompli with tacit approval. In short, these two conflicting commitment documents signed by the British government with the Arabs and the French respectively will lay the foundation for future turmoil in the Middle East, and thus push Lawrence to a classical tragic personal destiny.

;

;On June 5, 1915, in the Holy Land of Mecca, Hussein ibn Ali climbed a tower in the palace and fired an old musket at the Turkish fortress in the city . On that day, his two sons Ali and Faisal took the lead, and 1,500 Arab knights fired into the air in Medina. Later, Hussein's followers launched an attack on Turkish garrison positions in the Hijaz.

;

;Hussein issued a declaration to Muslims around the world: publicly condemning the Turkish authorities for "persecuting and massacring Arab nationalists and deviating from the spirit of Islam" and declaring Arab independence from the Ottoman Empire. He proclaimed himself king of the Hijaz kingdom.

;

;The famous "Arab Revolt" in the modern history of the Middle East broke out, and the stage with Lawrence as the protagonist officially opened.

;

;The "rabbit" looking for a prophet and a king

;

;"The heat of the Arabian Peninsula is like an unsheathed sword, leaving us speechless." October 16, 1916 In the early morning light of the day, when Lawrence accompanied the British Oriental Culture Secretary in Egypt to Jeddah, an important port controlled by Hussein after the uprising, he recorded his feelings at this moment in his diary.

;

;Before setting foot in Hijaz, he had already designed a new course for the Arab uprising and defined his role - "to find the unknown master soul for the uprising and measure him." The ability to advance the uprising to the goals I envisioned."

;

;After Hussein fired the first shot, the rebels and the Ottoman army entered a stalemate after a month of bloody street fighting. Moreover, the overarching mission of the Holy Guardian of Mecca did not go as expected - sparking a broader national uprising in the Arabian Peninsula, with no response in Syria or other regions.

;

;Lawrence believes that the core of the problem is the lack of a leader. Unlike Western political culture, what the Arab uprisings needed was not a brilliant politician, but a prophet, "not intelligence, not judgment, not political wisdom, but the flame of passion that can ignite the desert."

;

;While his superiors were discussing the details of cooperation with the rebel leaders, Lawrence took the opportunity to carefully observe Hussein's four sons: the eldest son Ali, the second son Abdullah, and the third son Feisal. Er and their youngest son Zaire.

;

;He first met the three princes except Faisal: Abdullah was cheerful by nature, gained weight early because of his greed for pleasure, and his personality was "too cautious, too calm, and too humorous"; the eldest son Ali saw He looks sad and tired, has no obvious ambitions, and is easily influenced by the people around him; as for Zaire, he is only 20 years old and likes to ride horses, wander around and play pranks. In addition, he is of Turkish descent and his appearance is different from Arabs. people. Lawrence concluded that it was difficult for them to become the kind of "armed prophets who triumphed in revolutions in history."

;

;Until Lawrence rode a camel 100 miles through areas controlled by multiple hostile tribes, he met Faisal who was stationed in a desert oasis with another tribe of tribesmen.

;

;"The first time I saw him, I felt that this was the man I came to the Arabian Peninsula to look for, the man who would bring all the glory to the Arab uprising." Faisal is thin and tall, with a This strange calmness, the passion when speaking and the iron determination behind the words deeply attracted Lawrence. This was something he had not found in the other three princes.

;

;Lawrence also wandered around his camp for a long time, chatting with the soldiers in fluent Arabic. He found that the more than 6,000 people summoned by Faisal included almost all the tribes in the western Hejaz. Although they had just experienced a defeat, their morale was high and they had unwavering confidence in victory. What united them and inspired them all the time was Faisal.

;

;He became more and more determined that Faisal was the "prophet" he was looking for - "Better than we hoped, my goal for this trip has been achieved."

;

;Hijaz This trip made Lawrence the first foreigner to go deep into the interior of the Arabian Peninsula to observe the battlefield. When he returned to Yanbu and waited for the ship to return to Cairo, he wrote a 15,000-word report in five days, making two important judgments: first, the British only sent a small number of troops to the Hijaz area; second, the real "prophet" who led the uprising was Fei Sal, not Abdullah as the British were familiar with him. He also pointed out: The only way to cooperate is that the British must accept the Arab way of fighting and adjust their strategies and expectations accordingly.

;

;Lawrence's report fundamentally changed British policy towards the Arabian Peninsula.

;

;In the huge bureaucracy of the British Empire, many smart ideas are buried every day. After writing reports in the Cairo office for nearly two years, Lawrence slowly discovered the rules of the game. He was very good at using bureaucracy and factional infighting to achieve his own goals.

;

;After returning from Hijaz, under Lawrence's dazzling operations, he deliberately guided, bypassed and even destroyed "obstacles" through memos, reports, and reports. In the end, his strategic vision for the Middle East battlefield was realized. It was adopted by all, and received the green light all the way from the top military and political leaders from Egypt to London. Soon, Clayton, director of the British Arab Bureau, informed Lawrence that he would be sent to the Arabian Peninsula to serve as a temporary liaison officer around Faisal.

;

;The superiors and colleagues happily sent away this "arrogant, inexperienced brat who pissed off everyone."

;

;;

;

;In 1921, Churchill (front row, center) and Lawrence (second row, fourth from right) during the Cairo Conference;(Visual China/ Picture);

;

;Becoming a "Son of the Desert"

;

;In December 1916, when Lawrence came to Faisal's camp again as a British liaison officer, in Faisal At the suggestion of Faisal himself, he put on a pure white silk robe. Throughout the war he lived as much as possible with the warriors of the Arab tribes.

;

;A typical day in an Arab tribal camp goes like this: An imam wakes the camp with prayers in the early morning, followed by a long breakfast. Every morning, anyone could come to Faisal to complain, petition, or settle disputes. He spent most of the day eating, drinking tea, and chatting with his staff and tribal leaders.

;

;Lawrence himself had always had a reputation for being impatient and disciplinarian, but he realized that these long, aimless chats were exactly how Arabs dealt with war and peace. Faisal used this as a glue to unite and maintain these loose tribes and clans around him. During the entire battle, he also served as a mediator between the various tribes, listening, making suggestions, cajoling when necessary, and often spending his own money to reconcile the two parties with interest disputes as soon as possible.

;

;Nearly all British military advisers sent to the Hijaz since the uprising had expressed contempt for the Arabs' fighting prowess. Lawrence agreed, but after fighting with them, he came to an important point: the Arabs cannot be measured by European war standards, and it is also difficult to organize and train them into European-style combat forces.

;

;What they are really good at is guerrilla warfare. In addition, they have a good understanding of the geographical environment and are very mobile. In war, when the strength and weapons and equipment are obviously inferior to that of the enemy, the weaker party should not engage the opponent head-on, but should "float around like air."

;

;From the first day of the uprising, both Hussein and his followers, and the British, had made capturing Medina, the second holiest city in Islam, their main goal.

;

;But Lawrence believed that the correct strategy was to abandon the heavily fortified Medina and let the Ottoman army stay there almost indefinitely. Let them barely maintain their supply lines and be unable to retreat or attack. This was equivalent to The rebels were captured. Eventually, he convinced the rebels to shift their strategic focus to harassing and destroying areas along the Hejaz Railway. This forced the Turkish army to send heavy troops to defend the railway and at the same time undertake ongoing maintenance work.

;

;In the Arab Revolt, the new goals and new strategies formulated by Lawrence reversed the situation, made the strikes more effective, and significantly reduced casualties. During the entire "World War I", the Arab rebel forces continued to launch guerrilla warfare, which effectively delayed the actions of the Ottoman army and helped the Allies finally defeat the Ottoman Empire.

;

;;

;

;Lawrence (left) and American traveler and journalist Lowell Thomas in Arabia;(Visual China/Photo);

;

;Become a legend - capture Aqaba

;

;The Gulf of Aqaba is located east of the Sinai Peninsula and west of the Arabian continent. It is a bay in the northern part of the Red Sea. The port of Aqaba is at its northern end. Judging from the plan map, it is an ideal staging area for attacking southern Palestine from Egypt. Sixty miles to the east is the lifeline of the Ottoman army on the Arabian Peninsula - the Hejaz Railway. In all future Middle East wars, this place will be a strategic location for offensive and defensive operations between Afghanistan and Israel.

;

;In 1914, when Lawrence was an archaeologist at the British Museum, he conducted an expedition in the Gulf of Aqaba. From the port of Aqaba to the interior, there are steep mountains that rise all the way, and then there is the inland desert. The only access inland from the port of Aqaba was through a canyon, along which the Ottomans built a network of blockhouses and trenches.

;

;Britain and France have their own calculations on how to deal with this obviously strategically important Red Sea port.

;

;At the end of January 1917, with Lawrence's contact and the cooperation of the British army, Faisal led his tribal army to seize Vodikh, an important port located in the north-central part of the Red Sea. French representatives began to lobby the British to send troops to attack and control Aqaba, so that the right wing could protect the British Egyptian Expeditionary Force in the Palestinian campaign launched in January of that year. Another more secret motive was to suppress the raging Arab uprising within the Hijaz territory, command them to coordinate actions as needed, and threaten them with a withdrawal of arms and gold support if they dissatisfied.

;

;Lawrence had always opposed Faisal's plan to attack Aqaba. He knew the Allied Powers' calculations: if the Arabs only cooperated with the British and French troops' offensive, Aqaba would become their "death trap" and they would end up empty-handed. For this reason, he did not hesitate to risk "treason" and revealed the British-French secret agreement to Faisal in February 1917.

;

;On the other hand, if the Arabs themselves control this northernmost port on the Red Sea, once the rebels move north to fight in Syria, the supply line can be greatly shortened from the original 300 miles to 60 miles.

;

;In March 1917, his boss Clayton sent Lawrence a secret order from Cairo: Do ​​not let Arabs appear in Aqaba. He understood the subtext - Clayton was even more explicit in a letter to a general: given the importance of Aqaba to Egypt's defense, the British must firmly control the seaport city after the war.

;

;In April of that year, when Lawrence was interrogating a dozen Turkish prisoners of war sent by the British army, he received new information: The garrison in Aqaba had just changed, and the number rarely exceeded 100, and the number of prisoners from Aqaba was small. There are only 200 Turkish troops stationed on the road between Kaba and Ma'an Town, the Hejaz railway hub in the interior.

;

;Lawrence quickly made a bold and risky decision - before the British and French troops invaded Aqaba, he united various desert tribes to convene an Arab armed force, and then crossed the mountains and ridges at lightning speed, and started from the inland highway. The last town of Ma'an captured the port of Aqaba. Through this victory fought for by the Arabs themselves, the influence of European powers in the region was minimized.

;

;This was also Lawrence's boldest and most famous military action in the "World War I". He used understatement to excuse other British officers around him and his superiors in Cairo, "So, regardless of orders or not, I went my own way."

;

;On May 7, 1917, Lawrence and 45 desert warriors set out from Vodijh, carrying gold coins worth 20,000 pounds and some rifles, riding camels into the Huer Desert in the northeastern interior, planning to recruit troops from the Hovitat tribe deep in the desert. He also encouraged the Syrian tribes to serve as a frontline for the rebels to move north and liberate Syria.

;

;They stopped at the Wadi Sirhan oasis as they entered Syria. More and more tribal representatives came to discuss alliances with the rebels and join the Arab independence cause. As Lawrence was entertained with round after round of tribal feasts, his guilt grew. He knew he was deceiving—after victory, the Allies would inevitably betray the Arabs.

;

;In an extremely complex and painful state of mind, he made a suicidal adventure - traveling north to Syria alone, detouring 400 miles through enemy territory, reaching as far north as Lebanon and the suburbs of Damascus, where he secretly met and fought for Potential allies of the uprising include tribal leaders and urban Arab nationalists. At that time, Damascus was the seat of the joint headquarters of the Ottoman and German armies.

;

;In a desert oasis, he met the highly prestigious Emir (;A title of nobility in the Arab world;) Nuri Sharaang. When the old chief living deep in the desert took out a bunch of copies of conflicting documents and asked him which British promise he should believe, Lawrence had no choice but to suggest choosing the one with the closest date.

;

;The old chief was persuaded, and Lawrence felt ashamed. "I used lies to gain a reputation for myself and became the undisputed leader of the fraud group."

;

;Lawrence said that he had truly woken up. , with the motivation to live. "I vow to spare no effort until we bring the final victory to the Arabs, respect the demands of the Arabs, and negotiate a fair and reasonable solution. Only by saving our lives in the troubled times in front of us can we compete with others at the future negotiation table. ."

;

;The swamp-like situation often inspires Lawrence's most incredible courage, resourcefulness and endurance. The legendary battle during World War I - the capture of Aqaba - took place.

;

;On June 18, 1917, Lawrence and the "Legendary Desert Warrior" Oda Abu Tai set out from Wadi Sirhan with 500 camel cavalry recruited and headed southwest. When they arrived at Bell, they found the footprints traced by the Ottoman army - all the most important water wells in the desert march had been blown up, and they had guessed that the rebel army's goal was Aqaba.

;

;Lawrence then commanded and led the Arabs to set up a divine formation. As early as more than ten days ago, he had laid the groundwork when he went north to Syria, leading a local squad to bomb the Destroyed a small bridge on the Hejaz Railway north of Damascus.

;

;On June 21, he led 100 soldiers 150 miles north to Amman on the railway, quickly destroyed a railway culvert, and then quickly returned. In Syria's southern border, the rebels launched a series of hit-and-run guerrilla warfare. This made the Turkish army completely unable to find any pattern, and had to disperse its forces and rush around to track them.

;

;A piece of good news came: a team they sent a few days ago had just captured and destroyed the Turkish military stronghold of Fulila, and the road from the interior to Aqaba was basically wide open. When they hurriedly bypassed the town of Ma'an and rushed to Aqaba, bad news came again: that morning, about five hundred Ottoman soldiers rushed to Fuwela to reinforce their reinforcements. at.

;

;After some thinking, Lawrence made a decision: he must take the initiative to find and annihilate the Ottoman reinforcements.

;

;At dawn on July 2, they found the enemy sleeping soundly in a narrow mountain pass south of Fuvilla. After a brutal fight, they killed 300 people and captured 160 people. . However, when the prisoners of war revealed that the defense of Ma'an Town was empty, the tribal warriors with banditry background screamed with joy and wanted to take the opportunity to loot this rich transportation hub. Lawrence tried his best to persuade them and promised them more compensation.

;

;As they moved quickly westward along the highway, they passed through empty Turkish forts and trench lines one after another - this proved the brilliance of Lawrence's plan that had not been recognized by his superiors. "The enemy never thought , we will launch an attack from inland. Among all their large defenses, not a single trench or a single outpost faces inland."

;

;After two days of stalemate, the troops led by Lawrence were almost exhausted. The ground captured the port of Aqaba. The next day, he set off for Egypt, rode a camel across 150 miles of desert to the Suez Canal, and notified the British army to quickly send reinforcements and transport food and other supplies.

;

;On July 10, 1917, Lawrence, who had been "missing" for more than two months, suddenly appeared in the Cairo office of the British intelligence agency, wearing a sloppy Arab robe. Within days, word of his heroic deeds spread among military brass in Egypt and London. At a time when the war on the Western Front was unfavorable and the French army mutinied, this British victory in the Middle East battlefield seemed particularly exciting.

;

;For the general public, this is a legend of a lonely hero that can arouse endless romantic imagination-a young, blue-eyed British officer dressed in alien robes, riding a camel, single-handedly went deep into the In the hinterland of the enemy's territory, secretly meeting and winning over potential conspirators, wandering among profit-minded people, and may be betrayed and executed at any time. Then, this hero led the tribal warriors to use ingenious tactics to win a series of incredible victories with less.

;

;The Commander-in-Chief of the British Egyptian Army, Wingate, proposed to senior officials in London that Captain Lawrence be awarded the British highest military honor, the Victoria Cross. Soon, he was promoted to colonel and nominated for the knighthood of the third class.

;

;This time, the rebellious Lawrence accepted it humbly - official recognition and honors can also be a powerful tool to influence the decision-making of high-level military officials to achieve his goals. The oath made in the desert: break through the "red line" set by the French, burn the war all the way to Syria, and let the British help the Arabs liberate Syria.

;

;Standing in front of the new Commander-in-Chief of the British Expeditionary Force in Egypt, Edmund Allenby, he described an exciting battle situation and future prospects. Immediately, Allenby sent an optimistic telegram to William Robertson, the Imperial Chief of Staff. In the end, the general coordinator, who regarded the Western Front as his top priority, promised to send an additional 50,000 troops to the Middle East for the offensive in the Palestinian battlefield.

;

;This was a key turning point in the Arab Revolts. The person who levered the gears was Lawrence.

;

;At the request of high-level officials, this "popular fried chicken" wrote an experience summary for overseas combat officers to refer to, which is called "Twenty-seven Recommendations". His most important lesson: abandon British habits and immerse yourself fully in the local environment, becoming familiar with "local families, clans and tribes, friends and enemies, wells, hills and roads."

;

;In 2006, when the United States launched military operations against Iraq, the commander-in-chief of the U.S. Army, General David Petraeus, ordered senior military officers to read the "Twenty-Seven Recommendations" and learn from Lawrence how to win local support in Iraq. People's hearts.

;Defaced Hero

;

;Beginning in October 1917, some people close to Lawrence found him in a state of quiet depression.

;

;Since serving as the British liaison officer during the Arab Uprising, he has been living a highly stressful life, like a great actor, performing "thrilling performances" non-stop. This is a huge drain on intelligence, physical strength, and spirit.

;

;The more important reason is the increasingly escalating killings. In Seven Pillars of Wisdom, he records the first close execution of a man, who then fell ill. At first, he led the Arabs to fight guerrilla warfare everywhere, trying to avoid killing innocent people. During an ambush, they captured a shepherd boy who bumped into them. Lawrence tied him to a tree to prevent him from informing the Turkish army, and released him before evacuating after the battle. As the war became more and more tense and cruel, he no longer cared about much.

;

;When the Battle of Fulila Gorge in the Battle of Aqaba ended, he described in extremely strange and poignant words how he saw hundreds of stripped Turkish soldiers’ corpses under the moonlight. They looked young, white, and peaceful, which made people feel compassionate. "So I arranged them all neatly, one by one. I was very tired myself, longing to be one of these peaceful people, rather than return to the high valley. Being among those mobs who had no moment of peace, noisy, and pain. Those people were still fighting for the spoils."

;

;Faced with the increasingly frequent killings, he seemed to be becoming more and more indifferent and indifferent. The more indifferent. But in a letter to a close friend in Oxford, he confided: "I hope the nightmare is over and I can wake up and live again. Killing people, killing Turks is really terrible." "I know that I have done this kind of thing hundreds of times." "Times, if possible, I will do it hundreds more times." "I can't last long in this game."

;

;Boss Clayton has noticed the mental state of this most capable officer. , he admitted that he was very worried about Lawrence's state, "We will remove him as soon as possible and don't continue to let him take risks, but the time has not yet come, because he is still needed now."

;

;November 1917 In order to cooperate with the Egyptian expeditionary force's offensive in Palestine, when Lawrence took a guard to survey the situation near the railway hub of Deraa in Syria, he was arrested by an Ottoman force and then taken to the local governor. Lawrence lied and claimed that he was a civilian from a mountainous ethnic group in the Caucasus. This ethnic group is known for its fair skin and light eyes and is exempt from military service.

;

;What follows is the most horrific scene in his entire memoir. Lawrence spends five full pages describing the details of the atrocities he suffered - he was first subjected to bloody violence by the Turkish governor. invaded; then whipped by four soldiers, followed by repeated kicks by the torture officer; and dragged back to the governor's room. Later he was dumped in a courtyard, and an Armenian came over to debridement and bandage him. The group then walked away.

;

;At dawn, Lawrence woke up and stumbled out of the town. With the help of a camel trader, he finds companions and then tells a "joyful story of escaping the clutches of his enemies through bribery and trickery."

;

;People discovered that after returning from Deira, something about Lawrence changed, and he became more aloof and indifferent. Since then, this daring man in the past has organized himself an elite guard of 50 people to accompany him at all times.

;

;Ten months later, when he led the Arab warriors back to the railway town, he ordered a bloody massacre with the flame of revenge, in which more than 4,000 people were killed, which is known in history as " Massacre in Tafas”.

;

;The mental trauma left by the Della incident on Lawrence was permanent - after the end of the "World War I", he poured out his inner feelings to Mrs. Bernard Shaw, who he regarded as a confessor-like existence. Feeling defiled and intensely self-loathed, after "that incident" he vowed to "renounce a decent life" from now on.
